User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the Unsaid/Unheard application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

accessibilityPreferences.description: User's accessibility preferences, stored as a JSON string.

role.description: The user's role (e.g., Primary user, Supporter/Volunteer).

Post.title: Post
Post.description: Represents a post in the community.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Post entity.

userName.description: Denormalized name of the user who created the post.

rawContent.description: The raw content of the post (text, voice, AAC taps, sign clip, camera photo).

accessibleAudio.description: Auto-generated audio version of the post.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the post was created.

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description: Represents a comment on a post.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Comment entity.

Reaction.title: Reaction
Reaction.description: Represents a reaction to a post.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Reaction entity.

type.description: The type of reaction (e.g., like, love, support).

HelpRequest.title: HelpRequest
HelpRequest.description: Represents a user's request for help.

id.description: Unique identifier for the HelpRequest entity.

duration.description: The duration of support needed (in hours).

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the request was created.

status.description: The current status of the help request.

VolunteerOffer.title: VolunteerOffer
VolunteerOffer.description: Represents a volunteer's offer to provide help.

id.description: Unique identifier for the VolunteerOffer entity.

status.description: The status of the volunteer offer.

Session.title: Session
Session.description: Represents a support session between a user and a volunteer.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Session entity.

participantIds.description: Array of UIDs for the two participants in the session.

status.description: The current status of the session.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the session was created.

chatLog.description: The chat log of the session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Lesson entity.

text.description: The text content of the lesson.

audio.description: The audio content of the lesson (URL or file path).

easyRead.description: The easy-read version of the lesson.

track.description: The learning track this lesson belongs to (e.g., 'Digital Skills').

id.description: Unique identifier for the NewsArticle entity.

title.description: The title of the news article.

content.description: The original content of the news article.

audioSummary.description: The audio summary of the news article.

easyReadBullets.description: Easy-read bullet points of the news article.

keyFacts.description: Key facts from the news article.

signCards.description: Sign cards for the news article.

Chat.title: Chat
Chat.description: Represents a single chat session between a user and the AI.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the chat was created.

messages.description: The history of messages in the chat.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support the 'Unsaid/Unheard' application's accessibility-focused features and collaborative environment. It prioritizes authorization independence, clarity, and scalability by using denormalization and structural segregation.  The data structure leverages path-based ownership for user-specific data and membership maps for collaborative data.  

*   **Authorization Independence:** Achieved through denormalization. For example, the 'Post' collection includes the 'userId' and 'userName' fields to avoid needing to fetch the User document to determine ownership or display name.  This approach is applied consistently across collections where authorization depends on related entities.
*   **Structural Segregation:** Different data types with different access control requirements are stored in separate collections. User-specific data (e.g., user profiles, help requests) are stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, while community posts are stored in the root collection `/posts`. This segregation simplifies security rules and improves query performance.
*   **QAPs (Rules are not Filters):** Secured list operations are enabled through structural segregation and the membership model. For example, listing public posts in `/posts` is secure because all documents in that collection have public visibility.  The 'visibility' field within the 'Post' entity also allows for filtering posts based on their intended audience (public, supporters-only, private).  For volunteer offers, the `helpRequestId` field allows listing offers related to a specific help request. Using roles stored directly within the User document in combination with user-owned subcollections will improve the security and performance of queries since the rule engine does not need to do a collection scan to determine authorization. The database includes global roles in the `/roles_admin/{uid}` collection, in order to support privileged operations for platform administrators.
